column4: hello, I'm compiling an application and I had two questions: 1 - what is the default installation directory for apps, 2 - how do I create a .deb file from my compilation (as opposed to doing make install)
what are you building ?
gnucash
that is already in the repos - you don't need to compile it
unfortunately the ubuntu packaged version does not provide database support
so I need to compile it
really, are you %100 sure, I thought it did
I tried with both the ubuntu repo and the getdeb repo
neither had mysql support
yea, just wondering what to set for --prefix
one moment - I'll give you some solid info in 2 minutes
thanks
!info gnucash
ah it's 2.4.6 that contains sql support
ok here is my suggestion
I believe 2.4.2 has it as well, it's just not compiled in the ubuntu versions
I'm all eyes

get the ubuntu source package of gnucash (apt-get source gnucash) modify the decription file to include mysql support, and recompile the package using the official ubuntu package/source/description files
!packaging | Akuma
that guide should explain how to re-compile the deb, but as you are using the ubuntu source you can pretty much jump to the last steps
cool, I'll take a look at that
its the best way to confirm compatability and formatting in same way as the existing ubuntu package
